revision_addressed: Fair comparison with matched parameter sizes (3-5 configs)

methodology.parameter_matching_approach: Selected configurations within 10K-25K range to isolate architectural effects

parameter_range.methodology_validation: Successfully isolated architectural effects from parameter count effects

decoder_impact_by_architecture.insight: Nonconvex decoders provide larger benefits for additive features

statistical_validation.methodology_strength: Parameter matching successfully isolated architectural effects

methodological: Established fair comparison framework for INR architecture evaluation
Developed parameter efficiency metrics (dB/K) as evaluation standard
Demonstrated isolation of architectural effects from parameter count
empirical: Quantified architectural inductive bias effects independent of model capacity
Validated multiplicative feature combination superiority across matched configs
Established parameter efficiency hierarchy for practical deployment decisions

revision_compliance.request: Choose 3-5 configs from exp001 results with almost matching sizes
revision_compliance.analysis_type: Fair comparison focusing on PSNR performance with matched parameter budgets
revision_compliance.outcome: Successfully isolated architectural effects and validated key hypotheses

immediate_priorities: Multi-dataset validation using fair comparison methodology
Expand fair comparison to include modern baselines (InstantNGP, TensoRF)
Computational fair comparison matching FLOPs not just parameters
next_steps.research_impact: Fair comparison framework should become standard for INR architecture evaluation to prevent confounding parameter effects with architectural innovations

analysis_quality_metrics.practical_applicability: Parameter efficiency metrics enable deployment decisions
analysis_quality_metrics.scientific_integrity: Addressed previous statistical discrepancies through fair comparison
